com.stormpath.sdk.oauth
Interface OauthAuthenticationResult

All Superinterfaces:
ApiAuthenticationResult, AuthenticationResult, Resource
All Known Subinterfaces:
AccessTokenResult
public interface OauthAuthenticationResult
extends ApiAuthenticationResult

An AuthenticationResult that indicates a client authenticated with your server-side API (eg REST API) via OAuth 2. The ApiKey used to authenticate the request can be obtained via ApiAuthenticationResult.getApiKey().

Scope

Any OAuth scope granted to the API client is available via getScope(). You can use the returned scope values to perform permission checks in your application before allowing or denying a particular feature. Scope values are application-specific and interpreted however you wish.

Application-specific scope values may be assigned to an OAuth Access Token when the token is created. Implement the ScopeFactory interface and provide your ScopeFactory instance to the application.authenticateOauthRequest(request) method at the time a new token is being requested (typically when a client requests a new token via your application's oauth token endpoint, e.g. /oauth/token).

Since:
1.0.RC
See Also:
application.authenticateOauthRequest(request), AccessTokenResult
